text: Gorgias (, ca. 487-376 BC), Greek sophist, presocratic philosopher and rhetorician, was a native of Leontini in Sicily. Along with Protagoras, he forms the first generation of sophists. Several doxographers report that he was a pupil of Empedocles, although he would only have been a few years younger. His theory was subjected of critique by Plato in his work Gorgias. Category:Presocratic philosophers Category:480s BC births Category:376 BC deaths
title: Gorgias
